DOC.brief_title: Effectiveness Atypical Antipsychotic Medication Outpatients With Anorexia Nervosa
DOC.detailed_description: Anorexia nervosa ( AN ) disease disorder eat characterize self-starvation , often leading extreme weight loss difficulty maintain normal weight . Symptoms behavior AN may include distorted body image , obsessive exercise , lack menstruation among woman , binge purge eat behavior , intense fear weight gain . Furthermore , people AN high risk mental disorder , depression anxiety , medical complication , organ damage , heart failure , osteoporosis . Current treatment AN include nutrition counseling , psychotherapy , medication . Previous study suggest certain medication usually use treat schizophrenia , also know atypical antipsychotic drug , may helpful treat people AN . Specifically , atypical antipsychotic medication olanzapine aripiprazole may effective improve overall symptom AN restore weight normal level . This study compare effectiveness olanzapine aripiprazole treat people AN . Participation study last 12 week . All participant first undergo baseline assessment include questionnaire interview AN symptom , physical exam , vital sign measurement , electrocardiograph ( EKG ) , blood draw . Participants assign randomly 12 week treatment daily olanzapine aripiprazole . Participants meet study doctor weekly 12 week treatment . During visit , study doctor monitor participant ' progress , medication dosage , vital sign , side effect . In addition , participant undergo repeat blood draw every 4 week repeat questionnaire every month treatment period . Upon complete 12 week treatment , participant repeat baseline assessment .
